title: RLHIM Pharmacy : University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
description: Information about the pharmacy at the Royal London Hospital for Integrated Medicine
sitename: University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
cleaned_text: The pharmacy is run by pharmacists who specialise in complementary medicines and is both a hospital and retail pharmacy. The pharmacy dispenses prescriptions for NHS funded, non-NHS funded and private prescriptions. Our team of pharmacists working closely with the RLHIM doctors and are involved in multidisciplinary team meetings to assure the best patient care. The preparation of each prescription does require time as most of the medicines are partly prepared on site before labelling and double-checking. As a result, waiting times will vary according to the prescription being dispensed. Patient contact Service management Loretta Chinwokwu Other contact information RLHIM Pharmacy Dispensary 0203 448 2600 Address RLHIM Pharmacy [Royal London Hospital for Integrated Medicine](https://www.uclh.nhs.uk/our-services/our-hospitals/royal-london-hospital-integrated-medicine) 60 Great Ormond Street London, WC1N 3HR For NHS funded medicines the normal prescription charges and exemptions apply. The Royal London Hospital for Integrated Medicine (RLHIM) no longer provides NHS- funded homeopathic remedies, mistletoe preparations and herbal medicines. Should you choose, you will be able to obtain these remedies from the RLHIM pharmacy with a private prescription from your doctor. You can speak to your clinician or the RLHIM pharmacy at your next visit about this. The pharmacy is also a registered retail pharmacy selling a wide range of products to the general public. These include. - Herbal and homoeopathic remedies - Nutritional supplements - Natural toiletries - Organic herbal teas. Walk in service Our pharmacists provide advice on using natural medicines for minor ailments. Opening hours The retail service is open Monday to Friday, 9am - 5pm. A telephone mail order service is available on 020 3448 2600. Please call for more information.
